I don't have time for this... He starts to walk away, but Brody grabs his wrist tightly
Take your hand off me, Brody.
What do you know about that hiker you ain't telling me? Brody waits a beat, then lets him go.

I told you, Brody...    I saw them leave. Let it go. Brody watches Clyde head off. He's even more paranoid now than before. What Brody doesn't notice... ANGLE ON THE SWAMP... Just below the water, sinking, the outline of the back of the Passat.
DARKNESS envelops the cabin.     A coyote HOWLS.
Sheryl on table, unconscious.     Her hand/finger bandage THE DOOR'S THROWN OPEN... Deacon throws Mike roughly to floor. He's tied per usual. NOTICE:    the back of Mike's shirt SOAKED in blood.
How do you expect me to do this?    Like this?
Do we need to provide you with some more motivation?
You wouldn't want to put that lovely bride of yours through a day like she had today again, now would you?
You'll never get away with this. We have friends and family. They know where we went. They'll come looking for us. They'll find us!

That may very well be... but they won't find your car. Clyde dangles the keys - HIS KEYS - in front of Mike. Deacon, Clyde and Ida leave. THE DOOR BOLTS, LOCKS. Mike limps over to Sheryl, he sees her bandaged hand.
Oh baby, what did they do to you?   I'm sorry. I'm so sorry.
(Without moving, barely audible)
Are they gone?
(Surprised)
Yeah. You're awake? Their entire conversation is no louder than a whisper. SHOOTING SCRIPT               OCTOBER 17, 2006   76. Sheryl turns to face Mike...       They kiss. SHERYL
I didn't swallow that shit she gave me. Sheryl spies the back of his jersey in a mirror's reflect SHERYL
Oh my God.     Mike... MIKE
It's okay.     I'm okay. SHERYL
You're not okay. We're not okay. What are we gonna do? MIKE
I don't know. Sheryl takes a moment. Thinks carefully about how exactly phrase this... Then... SHERYL
Maybe... we should just give them what they want? MIKE
What? SHERYL
If it stops them from hurting you and me... maybe we should... MIKE

Absolutely not. No fucking way. Forget the fact, that the moment you get pregnant, they'll kill me. Then the moment you give birth, you're dead. Beyond both of those reasons... ain't no fucking way I am going to give them our child. Tears POUR from Sheryl. MIKE
For all my coward marriage moments... I've thought about our child. Is that stupid? I picture what he'll be like... SHERYL
He?
Wishful thinking. I picture your heart... your eyes... And I picture us, raising him. Growing old with him. (Beat)
No. Ain't no fucking way I'm going to give him to them. They keep talking about sins... that would be the worst sin of them all. (Beat)
I'll get us out of this, Sheryl. I promise you.
Birds CHIRP overhead.     Sunlight streaks through the cl

ANGLE ON - A FINE CLOTH rubs delicately, but firmly one o the fetus jars (Timothy). Ida finishes, steps off the small stool.     The jars spa and shine brightly. She gazes at the fetus jars with love, affection. The pai of lives unfulfilled weighing heavy on her strong shoulde The trap door opens, Clyde comes down the steps. Ida turns to Clyde.     A beat...
It's time.
The morning fog engulfs the mountains.
SAM, the Ranger that greeted Mike and Sheryl, enters sipp a cup of coffee. EVELYN, 20s, a perky and adorable Ranger works at the desk.
Good morning, Sam.
Ain't no better than any of the other days, Evelyn, so bring the "glee" down some, would ya?
Sam grabs some papers from his mailbox.   Evelyn's used t Sam's moods.
Hey, Sam, do you remember a Virginia couple pass through here sometime Friday?
Friday? Well...There was one couple, but they didn't say where they were from.
Gal's mother's called three times this morning. Said she hasn't heard from her daughter since before she left and she didn't show up for work yesterday or today.
She sure this was the park they were coming to?
Yup. Woman's already offering up a reward.
Damn it. Have her fax some photos up here. Notify patrol.
Been a while since we had a couple go missing. Twelve months ago the last? Sam crosses to the bulletin board by the door. He studies flier of the missing couple that Sheryl had noticed.
(Concerned)
Nine.
Deacon enters.   Clyde and Ida are with him.
You don't have to check...   Nothing happened. Clyde and Ida are pissed.
